column1: Table S1. A comprehensive summary for characters of 370 C. albicans isolates collected in this study and 181 global genomes involved as comparators, including each isolates’ genomic data source, phylogenetic characters, antifungal susceptibility phenotypes, geographic and clinical origins, and mutations observed on genes associated with antifungal resistance.
Abbreviations: S, susceptible; I, intermediate; SDD, susceptible-dose dependent; R, resistant; WT, wild-type; NWT, non-wild-type.

3. Arendrup, M.C. & Patterson, T.F. Multidrug-resistant Candida: epidemiology, molecular mechanisms, and treatment. J. Infect. Dis 216, S445-S451 (2017)
